thread.title: Morning links: BYU student section sends support to Steve Sarkisian; Matt Wells to leave Logan?
thread.title_full: Morning links: BYU student section sends support to Steve Sarkisian; Matt Wells to leave Logan? | Deseret News

author: Ryan McDonald
title: Morning links: BYU student section sends support to Steve Sarkisian; Matt Wells to leave Logan?
text:
ROC creates video of encouragement for former Cougar quarterback; Utah's overall play, uniforms praised by ESPN; Utah State leader named one of 12 best mid-major coaches by Sports Illustrated.
More Coverage Outpouring of support shown to Michigan punter Gary Crowton leaves SUU for Oregon State, adding to his nomad coaching legacy If they were born at all, most current students at BYU were quite young when Steve Sarkisian quarterbacked the Cougars to a 14-1 record and No. 5 ranking in 1996.
That unfamiliarity didn't stop members of the Roar of Cougars student section from sending well wishes via a video posted on YouTube to the former signal caller and USC head coach, who was fired by the Trojans last week and has since entered a rehab facility to work through alcohol-related problems.
The 85-second clip features 10 students offering words of encouragement to Sarkisian.
"I was a baby when you were a quarterback here at BYU," said one, "but I just want to say that you're awesome, and once a Cougar, always a Cougar."
Utes ' overall play, uniforms praised by ESPN 
University of Utah football team on Monday, giving the Utes high marks for their performance on the field and in the uniform department.
Much of the conversation surrounding Utah's rise in national relevance has been negative, that its offense still isn't great or that it has had to scrape out wins against Cal and Arizona State.
Kevin Gemmell writes that it doesn't really matter how the Utes are getting the job done, just that they are.
"There are some who are high on the Utes — they received 16 first-place votes in the latest AP poll. And there are those who still believe they have no business in the College Football Playoff conversation because of the way they are winning," Gemmell assesses. "But so long as they keep winning, how they do it — or how they think they are doing it — really isn’t any of our business."
Elsewhere on ESPN, in a list of the 10 most memorable uniforms from around the country up to this point in the season, writer Sam Strong gave Utah's Homecoming throwback threads a nice review.
"It's no easy task to dig into the archives and find a uniform from a program's past that works at every level," Strong wrote. "Utah circumvented that issue by wrapping the best of its history into one uniform."
Utah State's Matt Wells on list of best mid-major coaches 
Aggies rolled over Boise State last weekend, and on Monday, Sports Illustrated's Pete Thamel and Thayer Evans put him second on a list of the top 12 mid-major coaches behind only Memphis' Justin Fuente.
"Wells is 23–11 in his third season," they write, "and he'll be a top candidate for any Pac-12 jobs—non-USC division—that open."
Ryan McDonald is a sports reporter at DeseretNews.com . Follow him on Twitter @ryanwmcdonald.
